{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3175989,"name":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","username":"RicDV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ricdv/{size}/188502_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T02:52:17.145Z","cooked":"

We bought SDS L2 set for Falcon swerve last year…and between money and lack of Falcons…we stopped our program. Now that State is upon us, we are going to switch the swerve from Falcons to NEOs. IF I am not mistaken…we only have to buy the 14T for each NEO…and encoders.

Am I correct on the Pinion? And I know that there are at least 2 encoders that will work for that set up. Which will we be happy with? Or is it a trick question? We know that one is $40…and the other is $70. Sometimes higher cost doesn’t mean it is the best.

EDIT: We are NOT running swerve right now…we are on a KoP…this is for after the season. I apologize for the confusion.

Thanks!

Ric

Mentor 5503

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T11:43:37.125Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":164,"reads":446,"readers_count":445,"score":914.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":432231,"topic_slug":"switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders","display_username":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 5503"},"post_url":"/t/switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders/432231/1","custom_user_title":"Mentor 5503","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3176043,"name":"Eliot Dunn","username":"Eliot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T03:59:50.308Z","cooked":"

Neos also have integrated encoders. You still want an absolute encoder like the CANcoder from CTRE, but I’m pretty sure you need an absolute encoder for falcon swerve too. I don’t know about pinions. Also please correct me if I’m wrong.

RicDV:

Now that State is upon us, we are going to switch the swerve from Falcons to NEOs

To clarify, your robot currently has working swerve using Falcon 500s, and you want to swap to NEOs mid-season?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T04:12:14.471Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":401,"readers_count":400,"score":90.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":432231,"topic_slug":"switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders","display_username":"Troy Dietz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"❤️ conflict-free COTS"},"post_url":"/t/switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders/432231/3","custom_user_title":"❤️ conflict-free COTS","reactions":[{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176094,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T05:41:18.251Z","cooked":"

Are you swapping from Falcons to Neos because you don’t have extras or…?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T05:41:18.251Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":362,"readers_count":361,"score":102.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":432231,"topic_slug":"switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders/432231/4","custom_user_title":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty","reactions":[{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176098,"name":"NathanNFM","username":"NathanNFM","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathannfm/{size}/181060_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T05:59:24.994Z","cooked":"

Pinion answer depends on if they are MK4 (motors on top) or MK4i (motors down near the wheel) if both falcons already have the same pinion you likely have the MK4i, in which case yes, you will want one of these kits per module.

andymark.com

MK4i NEO Pinion Kit

This Pinion Kit is used to allow NEO Motors to interface with the SDS MK4i Modules.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T05:59:24.994Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":349,"readers_count":348,"score":119.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":432231,"topic_slug":"switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders","display_username":"NathanNFM","primary_group_name":"AndyMark","flair_name":"AndyMark","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/7/2/72db24f824a25ae17c6413b3d02a345e47f060a9.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":59,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.andymark.com/products/mk4i-neo-pinion-kit","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":27}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14566,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"AndyMark Senior Mechanical Engineer"},"post_url":"/t/switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders/432231/5","custom_user_title":"AndyMark Senior Mechanical Engineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176102,"name":"jack greer","username":"jxgreer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jxgreer/{size}/211992_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T06:36:31.539Z","cooked":"

Switching motors on your swerve drive system from Falcon 500 motors to NEO brushless motors mid-season can be a risky endeavor, as it requires a significant change in the configuration and may affect your robot’s performance. However, if you decide to proceed with this change, there are a few components you’ll need to address.

First, you’ll need to acquire a 14-tooth pinion gear for each NEO motor. Both Falcon 500 and NEO motors utilize a 5mm bore and 0.7 module (20 DP) pinion, so ensure the pinion you purchase has the correct bore size and tooth count for your specific setup.

Next, you’ll need to consider encoders for your swerve system. There are multiple options available that are compatible with the SDS L2 swerve system and NEO motors, such as the Rev Robotics Through Bore Encoder (around $40) and the CTRE Mag Encoder (around $70). Each encoder has its advantages and drawbacks.

The Rev Robotics Through Bore Encoder is a more budget-friendly option, offering a simple and compact solution for measuring rotation. Its 1/4" through-bore design enables easy integration with your swerve system.

On the other hand, the CTRE Mag Encoder is more expensive but provides higher resolution and advanced features like support for absolute positioning. This might be beneficial if your team requires greater precision oradvanced control.

When deciding which encoder to choose, it’s important to consider your team’s budget, requirements, and preferences. Both encoders should work effectively with your setup. However, if the additional features of the CTRE MagEncoder are not necessary for your application, the Rev Robotics Through Bore Encoder should suffice.

Keep in mind that switching motors on swerve modules mid-season is a risky move, as it could introduce unforeseen issues or impact the performance of your robot. Be prepared to allocate time for testing and tweaking to ensure optimal functionality before participating in any competitions.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T06:36:31.539Z","reply_count":4,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":325,"readers_count":324,"score":120.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":432231,"topic_slug":"switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders","display_username":"jack greer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51801,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders/432231/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176115,"name":"wgorgen","username":"wgorgen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wgorgen/{size}/10106_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T09:28:18.661Z","cooked":"
jxgreer:

Next, you’ll need to consider encoders for your swerve system. There are multiple options available that are compatible with the SDS L2 swerve system and NEO motors, such as the Rev Robotics Through Bore Encoder (around $40) and the CTRE Mag Encoder (around $70). Each encoder has its advantages and drawbacks.

There is also the Thriftybot Encoder:

https://www.thethriftybot.com/bearings/Thrifty-Absolute-Magnetic-Encoder-p421607500

These are $30, so is very budget friendly compared to the CANcoder. It is compatible directly to the SDS modules (using the same bolt pattern as the CTRE encoder that the SDS modules has included). We’ve been using this encoder with our MK4is this year and they have worked great.

We prefer to use the analog encoder output rather than CAN because we were worried that the CAN wires would be located in a place where they could be damaged and we did not want to risk the CAN communication to the other devices on the robot if those wires were damaged. We only use the absolute encoder for initialization (and use the motor encoder for control once the positions are initialized), so running the analog encoder wires back to the RIO does not affect our overall control strategy.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T09:28:18.661Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":286,"readers_count":285,"score":122.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":432231,"topic_slug":"switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders","display_username":"wgorgen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.thethriftybot.com/bearings/Thrifty-Absolute-Magnetic-Encoder-p421607500","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Thrifty Absolute Magnetic Encoder","clicks":22}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32535,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders/432231/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176116,"name":"jack greer","username":"jxgreer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jxgreer/{size}/211992_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T09:36:52.075Z","cooked":"

Forgot these were around. Personally never tried them so not sure how they perform.
also 100 percent agree. We use cancoders right now and have had the wires shred in the gear twice now. Not a fun replacement.

We bought them set up for falcons…we are still driving a tank…

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T11:14:27.670Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":236,"readers_count":235,"score":47.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":432231,"topic_slug":"switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders","display_username":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":26760,"username":"troy_dietz","name":"Troy Dietz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/troy_dietz/{size}/135768_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 5503"},"post_url":"/t/switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders/432231/9","custom_user_title":"Mentor 5503","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176141,"name":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","username":"RicDV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ricdv/{size}/188502_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T11:15:46.978Z","cooked":"

Mk4i L2

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T11:15:46.978Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":229,"readers_count":228,"score":45.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":432231,"topic_slug":"switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders","display_username":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14566,"username":"NathanNFM","name":"NathanNFM","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathannfm/{size}/181060_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 5503"},"post_url":"/t/switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders/432231/10","custom_user_title":"Mentor 5503","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176146,"name":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","username":"RicDV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ricdv/{size}/188502_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T11:25:30.373Z","cooked":"

We have Falcons…for one corner. For the cost of one Falcon, we can get everything we need for the NEO set up…including encoders from Thriftybot. Plus with the issues of getting Falcons…

We know that there are pros and cons of each motor…just that we can put our hands on NEOs easier than Falcons.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T11:25:30.373Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":225,"readers_count":224,"score":45.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":432231,"topic_slug":"switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders","display_username":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":8002,"username":"Akash_Rastogi","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 5503"},"post_url":"/t/switching-sds-swerve-from-falcon-to-neo-and-adding-encoders/432231/11","custom_user_title":"Mentor 5503","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176159,"name":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","username":"RicDV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ricdv/{size}/188502_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T11:39:21.545Z","cooked":"

We are doing this for R&D. We are currently driving a KoP…and we are finishing the season with it. We are crazy…not that crazy! I did not consider the Rev option…I need to research that! Thanks!

We have been wanting to transition to swerve since last year…we are just getting to a position where we need to consider it…more informed.

Initially, we were looking at Falcons…however…the cost and the lack of them pushed us to NEOs. The pinions we knew we needed to get…as too the encoders.

I do agree that IF we were driving swerve already, and we had Falcons…it would have been an…interesting endeavor to swap. Of course, IF we were running them, and we had the time like we had (ran the first two weeks of the season…and we had some down time) it would have been risky…I doubt we would have done it anyway. Especially since the team I mentor doesn’t have any dedicated robotics classes to do this during school hours. Your point is valid. Thanks

jxgreer:

5mm bore and 0.7 module (20 DP)

Just a note, this is not accurate, they are 8mm bore with a 2mm keyway, and 20 DP, 0.7 module is not the same.

Also, the REV encoder has no place to mount on the current version, but maybe that’s something @PatrickW would consider adding in future revisions of the top plate.

We will. We have at least 8 SparkMax’s. Don’t forget…we can still go vertical with placing stuff as needed. Plus all this is for after State. We plan on buying more over the summer and at the beginning of the school year. More NEO’s, more SparkMax’s.
